DOC.brief_summary: Pain catastrophizing is conceptualized as a negative cognitive-affective response to anticipated or actual pain and has been associated with a number of important pain-related outcomes. The aims of this study are 1. To describe the characteristics of the patients and determinants of catastrophizing in chronic painful patients hospitalized in rheumatology in the Nîmes University Hospital 2. To describe the impact of the catastrophizing on the level of insomnia and the drugs consumption in chronic painful patients hospitalized in rheumatology in the Nîmes University Hospital
DOC.brief_title: Catastrophism Among Chronic Pain Patients in Rheumatology
DOC.criteria: adults hospitalized in the department of rheumatology of the Nîmes University Hospital with chronic pain (≥ 6 months) benzodiazepine or neuroleptic use for epilepsia, alcool, psychiatric disorders Restless Legs syndrom Obstructive Sleep Apnea narcolepsy
